intro: Chionolaena durangensis, commonly known as the Durango silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
